paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on a new TTR variant associated with cardiac amyloidosis, including penetrance data for affected and unaffected carriers.

patients.demographics: 1 index patient (63 years, male), 4 first-degree relatives (22 years, male; 2 siblings, 1 mother)

individual_records.phenotype_details: presented with anginal pain and arrhythmia, signs of hypertrophic nonobstructive cardiomyopathy
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The index patient presented at the age of 63 with anginal pain and arrhythmia.

individual_records.phenotype_details: asymptomatic carrier of the mutant TTR protein
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Electrophoretic analysis of the plasma from his first degree relatives identified the asymptomatic 22 year old son as an apparently heterozygous carrier of the mutant TTR protein.
Electrophoretic analysis of the plasma from his first degree relatives identified the asymptomatic 22 year old son as an apparently heterozygous carrier of the mutant TTR protein.
Electrophoretic analysis of the plasma from his first degree relatives identified the asymptomatic 22 year old son as an apparently heterozygous carrier of the mutant TTR protein.
Electrophoretic analysis of the plasma from his first degree relatives identified the asymptomatic 22 year old son as an apparently heterozygous carrier of the mutant TTR protein.

functional_data.summary: The variant results in a substitution of isoleucine with leucine at position 68, affecting TTR protein function.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in the family, as the index patient was affected and the son is an unaffected carrier.
variants.additional_notes: The index patient died before complete investigations were finished.
key_quotes: A new TTR genetic variant is reported in a German family where the index patient presented at the age of 63 with anginal pain and arrhythmia.
Electrophoretic analysis of the plasma from his first degree relatives identified the asymptomatic 22 year old son as an apparently heterozygous carrier of the mutant TTR protein.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
